greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of Fibonacci binary words of length n and starting with exactly k 1's (0<=k<=n). A Fibonacci binary word is a binary word having no 00 subword.
comment: Row sums are the Fibonacci numbers (A000045). Sum(k*T(n,k), 0<=k<=n) = F(n+3)-2 = A001911(n).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = F(n-k) if k<=n-2, T(n,n-1) = T(n,n) = 1, where F(j) are the Fibonacci numbers (F(0)=0, F(1)=1). G.f.: G(t,z) = (1-z^2)/[(1-z-z^2)(1-tz)].
maple: with(combinat): T:=proc(n,k) if k<=n-2 then fibonacci(n-k) elif k=n-1 or k=n then 1 else 0 fi end: for n from 0 to 15 do seq(T(n,k),k=0..n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
program: f us vs = ws : f vs ws where
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, May 12 2007
